(Baqarah 222) as revealed to Rasulullah(Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam), hence, go from the front, come from the back, but stay away from the anus and the time of menstrual cycle.? (Mishkaat 276) %0D%0A%0D%0AThe manners which should be observed at the time of intercourse:%0D%0A%0D%0A1) When the husband wants to have intercourse he should first arouse (by playing with her etc.) the desires of his wife's so she agrees to this act.%0D%0A%0D%0A2) The husband should not move until the wife is satisfied. If the husband does not satisfy the wife there is a great possibility that hatred would be created.%0D%0A%0D%0A3) Whilst being in the procedure of intercourse you should not be facing Qibla. (Tirmidhi)%0D%0A%0D%0A5) To read duas which are mentioned in Ahadith is very benificial because the child is protected from all Shaitani effects.%0D%0A%0D%0A6) After intercourse one should clean any impurity which is on him and perform ghusl (bath)%0D%0A%0D%0ABefore putting ihraam on, if one has a private place where the husband and wife can be alone and have intercourse then it is mustahab to do so. After that they should perform ghusl and then put the ihraam on. The husband and wife are not allowed to have intercourse after the ihraam is put on. Thus it would be best if the husband and wife dont sleep together. %0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0AMufti Ebrahim Desai
